visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly performance metrics of two product lines using accessible data visualization techniques with screen reader-compatible HTML tables

subtitle.text: Synthetic data demonstrating seasonal trends and variance

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two 12-month time series (Consumer Electronics and Industrial Components) showing synthetic revenue figures. Both series exhibit realistic seasonal patterns (summer peaks) with Consumer Electronics (μ=110.8k, σ=25.9k) showing greater volatility than Industrial Components (μ=100.8k, σ=20.3k). Data was generated using sinusoidal patterns with added noise (σ=8% of mean) to simulate market fluctuations. The spline chart was chosen to emphasize trend continuity while minimizing visual clutter, aligning with Tufte's data-ink ratio principles. Color choices (#3498db for consumer tech, #e74c3c for industrial) follow Cairo's perceptual distinctiveness guidelines, with sufficient luminance contrast (4.5:1) for accessibility. The dual-series presentation enables direct comparison while maintaining individual traceability through selective attention principles.
